required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Functional Mobility in the Elderly: Influence of Morphological, Neuromuscular and Training Parameters
clinical_study.official_title: Functional Mobility in the Elderly: Influence of Morphological, Neuromuscular and Training

lead_sponsor.agency: Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul

clinical_study.source: Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul

brief_summary.textblock: Life expectancy and elderly population are increasing. Health professionals try to provide longevity with good quality of life for this population, through the functional independence maintenance. In this context, physical exercise has an important role, specially the strength training. The ability to produce muscle strength is positively associated with the functionality and independence of older people. Different types of strength training can lead to different neuromuscular and functional gains. These types of interventions can help health professionals to determine characteristics of training for the elderly, aiming the maintenance of their functional independence. Thus, the purpose of this study is to determine the effects of a concentric strength training versus a concentric-eccentric strength training for knee flexors and extensors on structural, neuromuscular and functional parameters in older people, as well as to investigate the effect of a detraining period. Additionally, the investigators will try to identify which structural and neuromuscular parameters of lower limbs are better related to the functionality.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Pennation angle of rectus femoris, vastus lateralis and biceps femoris, bilaterally.
primary_outcome.time_frame: First evaluation, change from first evaluation to baseline, change from baseline to 8 weeks of training, change from 8 weeks of training to 4 weeks of detraining and change from 4 weeks of detraining to 8 weeks of detraining

primary_outcome.measure: Thickness of rectus femoris, vastus lateralis and biceps femoris, bilaterally.
primary_outcome.time_frame: First evaluation, change from first evaluation to baseline, change from baseline to 8 weeks of training, change from 8 weeks of training to 4 weeks of detraining and change from 4 weeks of detraining to 8 weeks of detraining

primary_outcome.measure: Fascicle length of rectus femoris, vastus lateralis and biceps femoris, bilaterally.
primary_outcome.time_frame: First evaluation, change from first evaluation to baseline, change from baseline to 8 weeks of training, change from 8 weeks of training to 4 weeks of detraining and change from 4 weeks of detraining to 8 weeks of detraining

primary_outcome.measure: Echo intensity of rectus femoris, vastus lateralis and biceps femoris, bilaterally.
primary_outcome.time_frame: First evaluation, change from first evaluation to baseline, change from baseline to 8 weeks of training, change from 8 weeks of training to 4 weeks of detraining and change from 4 weeks of detraining to 8 weeks of detraining
primary_outcome.description: Echo intensity determined from a gray scale analysis of the muscles at rest

primary_outcome.time_frame: First evaluation, change from first evaluation to baseline, change from baseline to 8 weeks of training, change from 8 weeks of training to 4 weeks of detraining and change from 4 weeks of detraining to 8 weeks of detraining
primary_outcome.description: Maximal vertical height in the countermovement jump

primary_outcome.time_frame: First evaluation, change from first evaluation to baseline, change from baseline to 8 weeks of training, change from 8 weeks of training to 4 weeks of detraining and change from 4 weeks of detraining to 8 weeks of detraining
primary_outcome.description: Time to rise from a chair, walk 3 meters, turn, walk back and sit again

primary_outcome.time_frame: First evaluation, change from first evaluation to baseline, change from baseline to 8 weeks of training, change from 8 weeks of training to 4 weeks of detraining and change from 4 weeks of detraining to 8 weeks of detraining
primary_outcome.description: Range in anterior-posterior and medio-lateral center of pressure movement during unipodal evaluation during 30 seconds

primary_outcome.time_frame: First evaluation, change from first evaluation to baseline, change from baseline to 8 weeks of training, change from 8 weeks of training to 4 weeks of detraining and change from 4 weeks of detraining to 8 weeks of detraining
primary_outcome.description: Gait speed for walking 10 meters at self-selected speed

primary_outcome.time_frame: First evaluation, change from first evaluation to baseline, change from baseline to 8 weeks of training, change from 8 weeks of training to 4 weeks of detraining and change from 4 weeks of detraining to 8 weeks of detraining
primary_outcome.description: Time to stair ascent and descent stairs

primary_outcome.time_frame: First evaluation, change from first evaluation to baseline, change from baseline to 8 weeks of training, change from 8 weeks of training to 4 weeks of detraining and change from 4 weeks of detraining to 8 weeks of detraining
primary_outcome.description: The distance that the subjects can walk during 6 minutes

primary_outcome.time_frame: First evaluation, change from first evaluation to baseline, change from baseline to 8 weeks of training, change from 8 weeks of training to 4 weeks of detraining and change from 4 weeks of detraining to 8 weeks of detraining
primary_outcome.description: Maximal number of repetitions during 30 seconds

primary_outcome.measure: Power of knee extensors and knee flexors
primary_outcome.time_frame: First evaluation, change from first evaluation to baseline, change from baseline to 8 weeks of training, change from 8 weeks of training to 4 weeks of detraining and change from 4 weeks of detraining to 8 weeks of detraining
primary_outcome.description: Power during maximal concentric and eccentric contractions

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of torque production of knee extensors and knee flexors
primary_outcome.time_frame: First evaluation, change from first evaluation to baseline, change from baseline to 8 weeks of training, change from 8 weeks of training to 4 weeks of detraining and change from 4 weeks of detraining to 8 weeks of detraining
primary_outcome.description: Rate of torque production during maximal isometric contractions

primary_outcome.measure: Strength of knee extensors and knee flexors
primary_outcome.time_frame: First evaluation, change from first evaluation to baseline, change from baseline to 8 weeks of training, change from 8 weeks of training to 4 weeks of detraining and change from 4 weeks of detraining to 8 weeks of detraining

primary_outcome.measure: Strength of knee extensors and knee flexors
primary_outcome.time_frame: First evaluation, change from first evaluation to baseline, change from baseline to 8 weeks of training, change from 8 weeks of training to 4 weeks of detraining and change from 4 weeks of detraining to 8 weeks of detraining

primary_outcome.measure: Strength of knee extensors and knee flexors
primary_outcome.time_frame: First evaluation, change from first evaluation to baseline, change from baseline to 8 weeks of training, change from 8 weeks of training to 4 weeks of detraining and change from 4 weeks of detraining to 8 weeks of detraining

intervention.description: Subjects will be submitted to 8 weeks (16 sessions) of a concentric training for knee flexors and knee extensors. This training will be performed in an isokinetic dynamometer at 70% of the subject's maximal voluntary isometric contraction.

Subjects will be submitted to 8 weeks (16 sessions) of a concentric-eccentric training for knee flexors and knee extensors. This training will be performed in an isokinetic dynamometer at 70% of the subject's maximal voluntary isometric contraction.

facility.name: Exercise Research Laboratory, School of Physical Education, Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul
